description.p: PROCESS AND REACTOR FOR THE PLASMOGENIC EXTRACTION OF ALUMINA AND BY-PRODUCTS FROM BAUXITE
The present invention refers to the technical field of alumina extraction from bauxite.
The subject of the invention is a process aiming - under economical and/or ecological conditions - as an alternative to Bayer process.

Bauxite is the mineral wherein it is possible to find the greatest aluminium concentration (65÷85%), if corundum (or ruby) is excluded from which, anyway, it is not possible to extract the metal by means of usual pyrometallurgical reducing processes, due to elevated refractoriness and high melting temperature.

From a chemical point of view bauxite is a compound mixture, together with crystallization water, such AI2O3 (50% to 60%), Fe2O3 (10% to 20%) and, at a lesser extent, SiO2 (1 % to 10%). The mineral contains, in addition, minor amounts of titanium, zirconium, vanadium and other transition metal oxide containing minerals. The water content, at last, can vary from 20 to 30%. Reference chemical formula for bauxite is Al2O3.nH2O, that is the formula for a hydrated alumina.
As it is known the most used industrial process in order to obtain pure alumina from bauxite, is known as Bayer process. Said process is characterized by the following steps:
grinding of bauxite;
dissolution at some tens of Celsius degrees and successive separation of insoluble materials;
Al (OH)3 precipitation by temperature lowering;
calcination.

Bauxite contains Al, Ti, Fe and Si oxides at different proportions and percentages. The extraction efficiency is extremely low and this results in the presence of large amounts of metal elements in the process by-products, usually named red mud.

At the end of the process steps red mud, in the form of liquid waste,
is pumped far from the plant to be disposed in artificial lagoons. Such operation results in a severe environmental impact, due either to enormous volumes of refused and artificial lagoon disposed materials or to the loss of alumina and other valuable material waste, occurring in disposed red mud, as result of low extraction yield in Bayer process.

Therefore, there is a need in said specific field to provide for alumina production process with contemporary reduction of environmental impact from by-products, both in terms of amount and from point of view of the quality of what, at the end of the processes, anyway must be handled as a waste.
This requirement is met by the process according to the present invention offering, in addition, other advantages as it will be apparent hereinafter.

It is therefore a specific subject of the present invention a process for the transformation, in a plasma generated from at least an inert gas, optionally in the presence of air, of bauxite - occurring combined aluminium into elemental aluminium vapour with production of concentrated alumina (AI2O3) with lower impurity amounts compared to starting mineral.

The process which is the subject of the present invention allows, at the same time, to generate separable by-products, each of which is "enriched" in one of the major other valuable bauxite occurring elements/compounds (titanium, iron, silica), to be sent to the respective reference market, thus drastically reducing the proportion of material to be handled as true waste.
In the process according to the invention the bauxite is subjected to the following operations:
- optional bauxite grinding;
- optional drying at a temperature from 60 to 250°C;
- optional addition of an electrical conductivity increasing agent;

- introduction into a plasma arc reactor;
- optional generation of a reducing atmosphere inside of the reactor;
- treatment within the arc plasma reactor according to the following operating conditions:
electrode potential difference from 10 to 10000 volts;
reaction chamber temperature from 600°C to 3500°C;
- obtaining of a solid and compact product, remarkably reduced in volume;
- recovery of the fumes coming out of the reactor, by means of cooling, for collecting AI2O3 resulting from elemental aluminium evaporation in the reactor;
- obtaining, at reactor exit, of a solid, compact and layered by-product, wherein there are portions, each being enriched of one of the major valuable components of the starting mineral;
- optional separation of alumina enriched portion, and repetition of previous steps in a successive process stage.
Particularly, according to the invention the drying is obtained at a temperature within 100-115°C range.

Again according to an embodiment of the invention, the electrical conductivity increasing agent is selected from the group consisting of water, aqueous saline solutions, salt containing liquid waste and salt containing wet semi-solid waste. Liquid waste and wet semi-solid waste can belong to the category of mud resulting from process water treatment or industrial water purification, or liquids from ion-exchange resin regeneration.

Further, according to the invention, the plasmogenic inert gas is selected from argon and/or nitrogen and the reducing atmosphere is generated with at least a reducing gas optionally in combination with at least another inert gas. As an example, reducing gases can be selected from methane, propane, hydrogen, etc. or mixtures thereof

Further according to the invention, the plasma can have the arc transferred configuration, wherein anode and/or cathode can consist of a
bar, plate, ring inside of the reactor.

In addition, according to the invention, the cooling of elemental aluminium containing fumes occurs, preferably, under "dry" conditions, in air flow or anyway in oxygen containing gas flow, in order to favour the formation of high degree purity alumina. As an alternative, the fume washing is carried out under wet conditions, employing alkalizing solutions (preferably based on sodium hydroxide). According to this variant of the invention, the resulting liquid containing the alumina chemical precursor is sent to a second drying and roasting stage in arc plasma reactor, under reducing atmosphere, at a temperature preferably about 1200°C, in order to produce the alumina according to the reaction:

Another subject of the invention is a reactor provided with refractory crucible made of metallic or ceramic, or anyway high temperature resistant material, suitable for the transformation under plasma conditions of bauxite

- occurring aluminium into elemental aluminium vapour and of by-products into inert and compact solid, wherein there are portions, each being enriched of one of the major valuable bauxite components, according to the above process, comprising the following parts:
- means for grinding and, anyway, reducing the average granulometric size of the material to be treated;
- means for drying the material to be treated;
- means for introducing the material to be treated and optional additives into the reactor;
- an anode and a cathode;
- means for starting the discharge between the anode and the cathode using DC or AC current;
- optional means for handling the cathode and/or the anode vertically, horizontally or rotatively inside of the reactor;

- means for generating a reducing atmosphere inside of the reactor ;
- means for dry cooling aluminium vapour containing fumes;
- means for wet cooling aluminium vapour containing fumes;
- means for aspirating alumina obtained by reaction of aluminium vapour and oxygen;
- means for collecting alumina produced by dry cooling;
- means for collecting hydrated alumina produced by wet cooling;

Particularly, according to the invention, in the reactor provided with refractory metallic material crucible, the anode or cathode can consist, at least partially, of the reactor bed or reactor as such.
Again according to the invention, in the reactor provided with refractory ceramic material crucible, the anode or the cathode consist of conductive material in the form of bar, plate or ring.

Further, according to the invention, the cathode and the anode can consist of conductive material, preferably stainless steel or graphite, in the form of optionally holed bar in order at least an inert gas can flow therethrough.
The invention refers moreover to a solid and compact product obtained according to previously described process.

A further subject of the invention is the use in the specific interested industrial fields of each fraction enriched of iron, aluminium or titanium, extractable from the solid and compact product remarkably reduced in volume, obtainable according to above described process. For example each of the fraction enriched of iron, aluminium or titanium, extractable from above said product, advantageously can be used in the respective metallurgical field.
The adoption of the present invention displays the advantages described below:

- the process using the plasma reactor allows elemental aluminium to be released in reactor exiting gaseous phase, said aluminium during the subsequent condensing step in the presence of oxygen resulting in the
formation of high degree purity alumina. As an alternative, elemental aluminium recovered from gaseous phase by means of washing with alkalizing liquids allows hydrated alumina precursor to be formed, again with elevated purity degree. From this precursor, by means of heat treatment, preferably with arc plasma, purified alumina is produced;
- process by-products are no more a waste product being intermediates "enriched" of industrially interesting materials, therefore suitable to be marketed in respective reference fields.
Therefore what up to now has been always a waste product with elevated environmental impact has been transformed in a set of industrially interesting materials including iron and titanium dioxide;
- the plasma treatment acts faster than other pyrometallurgical systems thus reducing transitory regime times and allowing a remarkable energy saving;
- as to by-products the extraction of a ferrous fraction with contemporary transformation thereof from diamagnetic to paramagnetic form is obtained;

- these paramagnetic iron compounds represent a good commercial value materials for metallurgical industry. The extraction of these iron compounds can be carried out according to any mining and metallurgical known techniques.

Up to now a general character description of the invention has been given. With reference to the figure and the following example a more detailed description now will be reported, aiming to a better explanation of objects, features and advantages of the invention
Figure 1 shows a block diagram of the process according to a specific embodiment of the invention in an arc transferred plasma reactor.
Example 1

In the test a previously ground and dried bauxite sample has been used. The alumina content of the non-treated dried sample is:
Al203 68%,

The sample has been introduced into the reactor and continuously fed by means of a cochlear loading system. According to this configuration, the reactor inside consists of a refractory material thermally isolated reaction chamber. The reactor outside consists of a jacket enveloping a temperature control system using heat exchange fluids. In this example the thermal exchange fluid is water, but thermal exchange solutions based on aqueous, synthetic organic and inorganic materials, diathermal oils, refrigeration gases etc. can be also used

According to this reactor configuration, both electrodes are made of graphite, being placed along the vertical axis, in the center of the reactor. The lower electrode, placed on the bottom of the reactor, is fixed, while the higher electrode is adjustable in order to assure the correct operating distance, depending on the reaction conditions. According to a possible different configuration, the electrodes are hollow: the internal cavity of electrode serving to carry directly the plasmogenic gas in electric arc field. Moreover, the same gas flow regulates the electrode operating temperature.
According to the configuration used in the described test, the plasmogenic gas is insufflated in the proximity of the electric field, by means of heat- resistant metal duct.

In the higher part of the reaction chamber an aspiration system of produced gases is placed. Such system comprises a cooling and condensation section (in this case using air heat exchange), for the recovery of alumina containing vapours
Exact electrode distance and potential difference have been set-up, reducing and plasmogenic gas flow (in this case nitrogen) and plasma have been activated and the reaction starts.

Under these reaction conditions, bauxite melts and, as soon as the system
reaches a temperature around 2600°C, occurring aluminium, transformed in elemental aluminium vapour, is aspirated into the recovery duct gas. According to the configuration used in the test, the combination of aluminium vapour with oxygen resulting in alumina formation is further enhanced by air suction in the cooling duct.

The produced alumina condenses on the cold walls of collection system from which it is recovered using mechanical systems. In this case mechanical shaking has been used. Recovered white dust has an alumina content of:
The solid portion of the introduced material in the reaction chamber, after the treatment, has a residual alumina content of:
Essentially with respect to the bauxite introduced in the reaction chamber, having an alumina content of 68%, approximately 70% of occurring alumina has been extracted.

Solid residue in the reactor casts during the aluminium extraction process and is allowed to be layered during the successive cooling step. With stratification it is obtained a solid containing differentiated zones enriched of various metallic components originally occurring in bauxite contained compounds, i.e. residual AI2O3, paramagnetic Fe203, TiO2 ,Si02, mostly chemically reduced to elemental state.,
These compounds can be separated using known techniques and marketed in the respective reference fields.

AI2O3 enriched residue fraction can be separated and sent to a second plasma treatment stage, or used again as starting material for the process, thus alumina total extraction yield, with respect to the untreated bauxite, being higher than 95%.

The present invention has been described by an illustrative, but not limitative way, according to preferred embodiments thereof, but it is to be
understood that variations and/or modifications thereof can be carried out by those skilled in the art without departing from the scope of the invention as defined according to enclosed claims.
